intro: Trukia megacarpa, commonly known as the giant seed tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, woody蒴果 (capsule) that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellowish, typically appearing in clusters.
